title: Nick Clegg's wife Miriam Gonzalez Durantez insisted there's much more to life' than politics
text:
Nick Clegg's wife Miriam Gonzalez Durantez has insisted there is 'much more to life' than politics and wants everyone to 'have perspective' in this 'divisive time'.

The 50-year-old lawyer appeared on Lorraine this morning to speak about her global initiative encouraging gender equality, and was quizzed on whether or not she missed being in the political spotlight.

Her husband resigned as leader of the Liberal Democrats in 2015 and the mother-of-three admitted that she doesn't miss 'time-consuming' politics.

She did admit to missing London after relocating to the US, but is happy to focus on her own career.

She is married to Nick Clegg, 52, who resigned as leader of the Liberal Democrats in 2015 and says she doesn't miss politics

Miriam Gonzalez Durantez, 50, appeared on Lorraine today where she opened up about her global initiative encouraging gender equality

She said: 'It's time-consuming, so I don't think you can be close to politics for a long time but I do miss London in particular. It's a place very close to my heart.

'I think the world generally, we are much more divided. I come from a country [that has suffered from civil war.

'So when people tell me this is a divisive time, I think "put things in perspective". We all believe in an open world.

'We may disagree passionately about issues but still there is much more to life than politics.'

Miriam told of how she recently launched 'Inspiring Girls' an initiative to encourage young women to pursue careers not traditionally chosen by women, such as those in science and mathematics

Miriam recently launched 'Inspiring Girls' an initiative to encourage young women to pursue careers not traditionally chosen by women, such as those in science and mathematics.

The programme, which is based in 13 countries, works with girls from the ages of 12-14 and connects them to older female role models and the lawyer admitted that although she is mother to three boys, she still feels passionate about inspiring girls.

She said: 'It's important to make girls feel as empowered as boys. It's something that concerns everybody.'

As part of the scheme, women have been asked to record videos of themselves giving words of inspiration to younger girls.

Miriam said: 'We believe that inside every woman there is a role model.

She feels that it makes a 'huge difference' to be able to look up to another female and confessed she was 'surprised' by the number of young women who want to embark on traditional career paths

'You self-record a video and you send it to us and you tell us if you are available to talk in schools.

'Because there are so many wonderful women who are not in magazines, so this is about connecting them to the girls.'.

She went on to explain that it makes a 'huge difference' to be able to look up to another female and confessed she was 'surprised' by the number of young women she's spoken with who want to embark on traditional female career paths.

She said: 'I think it makes a big difference. You cannot really dream of doing something unless you see it.

'You would be surprised how many girls I asked tell us they want to be in traditional female jobs. It's just about connecting normal women to girls.

'I think it's about hope and it's also about how easy this is, we go around problems especially from gender issues it's like can't we just go into problem solving mode and make things better.'
description: Appearing on today's Lorraine, Nick Clegg's lawyer wife Miriam Gonzalez Durantez, 50, said that she doesn't miss the world of politics since her husband resigned in 2015.
